definitions.definition: To travel across, often under difficult conditions.
definitions.example: He will have to traverse the mountain to get to the other side.

definitions.definition: To visit all parts of; to explore thoroughly.
definitions.example: to traverse all nodes in a network

definitions.definition: To lay in a cross direction; to cross.
(artillery) To rotate a gun around a vertical axis to bear upon a military target.
, To climb or descend a steep hill at a wide angle (relative to the slope).
To (make a cutting, an incline) across the gradients of a sloped face at safe rate.
definitions.example: The last run, weary, I traversed the descents in no hurry to reach the lodge.

definitions.definition: To act against; to thwart or obstruct.
To pass over and view; to survey carefully.
To plane in a direction across the grain of the wood.
To use the motions of opposition or counteraction.
